item.title: Publications

item.title: Why we need a 64-bit OS for Raspberry Pi?
item.description: More than 18 millions of Raspberry Pis have been sold ‘til today. This small, cheap computer has been popular to hobbyist or students as platform to deploy sensor applications, or to create a micro data center. Although it looks powerless comparing to standard desktop computer or laptop, but the latest models (Raspberry Pi 3 and 3B+) are capable of executing ARM 64-bit instructions since their processors are based on ARMv8 architecture.
